title: Keep messages in same window
content:
Hello,

I would really like to keep all my received emails and replies to be in the same (inbox) window?

Example: I open a message a window opens with the message. I read the message, when I reply it opens ANOTHER window (can't stand this).

Is there way to keep all the messages linear? And not have multiple windows open?

Many thanks and hope this post makes sense. cheers Michael j
creator: michaeljmann2000

title: Thunderbird emails with attachments not sending
content: A few days ago emails with attachments (pdf, jpeg), and of various sizes, stopped sending (timed out). The problem appears to only exist when I send from my desktop, not using webmail. All had been working fine prior to a few days ago. Emails without attachments send fine. Incoming emails (with and without attachments are also fine). I have had several discussions with my internet service provider who claim there is no issue at their end. I have checked my account/server settings in Thunderbird and all seems correct there. I'm using the POP mail server, if that is relevant. Any thoughts or suggestions welcome. Not being able to send emails with attachments if a major impediment.
creator: grantdixon

title: Problem with Bullet Lists
content:
I have noticed an issue with lists (bullet & numbered) for a while now and thought it was about time I checked to see if it can be sorted!

If I start a new message and there is no text and then I press the Bullet button then this is OK.

However, if I.....

  • Start with a blank message
  • Type a line of text
  • Hit Return twice
  • Press the Bullet button - this moves the cursor up to previous line
  • Press the Bullet Button - this moves the cursor up to the end of text on previous line
  • Press the Bullet button - this put a bullet symbol at start of the line of text

This makes it very frustrating trying to add a bulleted list in the middle of a message.

I saw a previous thread when the OP was having the same problem and his solution seemed to be connected with his HTML signature, but I don't have a signature set up.

This is version 115.9.0 (32-bit) running on Windows 10.

Any suggestions would be gratefully received!
creator: MysteryMan

title: export function
content: I want to export mails only of a certain mail account (I have got 6). I would like not to export ALL accounts in ONE zip file but I want to have different zips. Is that possible? Why do I want that? I am active in 3 different organisations and I have a private account and - it can almost not be avoided - a google mail account. So when I look for a certain mail I know which zip I have to import and to look for it. Years ago I used MS outlook and I had the possibility to create archives as defined for each account and - if necessary and wanted - for each year. Is this also possible in Thunderbird? If yes HOW? Many thanks in advance!
creator: f.krajnik

title: Donate
content:
Vážení a Milí!

Dobrý den!

Původně jsem chtěl přispět. Podpořit Vás. Jenže, při pokusu o "donate" jsem byl znechucen nutností vyplnit nechutně dlouhou řadu osobních údajů. Byl jsem však mile překvapen, že jste nechtěli moje datum narození, rodné číslo a číslo občanského průkazu. Možná, kdybych vyplnil předchozí údaje o bydlišti (jako by číslo karty a jméno držitele nestačilo), následoval by dotaz na rodné číslo. Ne, pánové, opravdu ne. V dnešní době vyžadovat tolik osobních údajů, které ani nejsou třeba k obyčejné platbě... Chápu, že při finanční kontrole musíte doložit své příjmy. Ale kdyby jste zkusili PayPal nebo ideálně Google Pay, věřím, že darů by se Vám sešlo mnohonásobně více. Možná by se hodilo šikovné tlačítko "donate" přímo v Mozille. Místa je tam pro něj dost. Přes Google Pay bych Vám moc rád přispěl. Ale takhle ne. Takhle Vám za Vaši práci mohu jedině poděkovat! Takže Vám za Vaši práci děkuji! Mozilla je úžasná!

Pavel Vogt
creator: leopavel33

title: Problem With Thunderbird Downloading New Email Messages from Server
content:
My Thunderbird email client application is connected to two different family email accounts. One account works as usual but recently the second experiences a connection problem. It sometimes takes as long as ten minutes before a new email message in the server's inbox is picked up by the Thunderbird client and downloaded to the Thunderbird inbox. I have a suspicion it may be related to another Thunderbird symptom described below: At the lower right corner of the display is a blue "progress" bar. Sometimes it is a solid bar displaying progress in a typical manner. But during the long wait for new email to be downloaded from the server, it is a non-solid bar that is alternating back and forth. It appears that it may be working on something (similar to the circles in some applications that go round and round while working). If I click on the bar when it is in this mode I get the pop-up display described below: The pop-up box title is "Activity Manager" and it says the activity is "Indexing Messages". This message also contains a "progress bar" that is forever at the very beginning of its range. Further information just below the bar says "Indexing 73 of 1,067 messages in Sent Items (6% complete)." Several weeks ago this message was at 17 messages. So it appears to have indexed 66 sent messages in several weeks. If this is what it interrupting the prompt downloading of new email, I won't live long enough for my system to be right.

Can anyone guess what might be going on?
creator: dhaag27

title: Thunderbird opens much slower since upgrading from win7 to win10
content: I finally upgraded from Window 7 to Windows 10. Now Thunderbird opens much slower that it did under win7. IT takes about 15 seconds to open now, where it was almost instantaneous with Win 7. I have version 78.14.0. I have tried the following: Removed or disabled all add-ons, Reduced the number of emails in Trash folders by at least 50%, I compacted all folders, I have my email shield in AVG turned off, none of that has made any difference. I don't know what else to try. Any ideas?
